meanings.definition: To gather or pleat (fabric) by sewing a series of parallel lines of stitching.
meanings.sent1: She was shirring the dress to make it fit better.
meanings.sent2: The tailor shirred the fabric to create a beautiful design.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried shirring the curtains with its claws, thinking it was helping.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter shirred through the quiet room, bringing smiles to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The wind shirred the leaves together, creating a rustling sound.

meanings.definition: A series of parallel lines of stitching used to gather or pleat fabric.
meanings.sent1: The shirring on the skirt added a lovely texture.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate shirring on the blouse.
meanings.sent3: The shirring on the pillow looked like tiny waves in the fabric.
meanings.sent4: The shirring on the curtains reminded her of rows of gathered flowers.
meanings.sent5: The dress sparkled with shirring details, catching the light beautifully.
